reviews.review: 买了不敢玩系列游戏

今年我已經花了560個小時在這款遊戲上面,從我購買這款遊戲之前,我已在Youtube上觀看過許多知名實況主遊玩這款遊戲的影片,我非常欣賞這遊戲的創意,他可以說是改變了這兩年主流遊戲的方向,多年來,線上遊戲一直被英雄聯盟所稱霸,但英雄聯盟是一款不需要付費也能遊玩的遊戲,而PUBG即使有了收費門檻,還是能達到如此高的遊玩人數,是一件值得在遊戲史上留名的事情,但我覺得藍洞虧待了這款遊戲,玩家們所期待的是遊戲品質,無論是伺服器的穩定度,還是使用違法程式的玩家,每一次的更新,卻都讓玩家們失望了,不斷的對UI作些許的更動,出更多的槍枝服裝造型,都只是吸引玩家花錢的手段,而不會吸引玩家繼續玩下去,幾個月前出了新地圖,讓整體遊玩節奏快了許多,也讓很多已經對這款遊戲失去熱忱的玩家回來玩,但幾個月後,風潮又不在了,因為老玩家還是對伺服器和違法程式的使用感到新涼,如果有一天藍洞能將這些問題處理好,我相信這是一款值得讓玩家一直玩下去的好遊戲

這是我最喜歡、最玩不膩的遊戲，
真心希望能有效打擊外掛，真的太氾濫了

2018/12/01  早上開起STEAM啟動器給了警示
"您在 PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS 中已遭遊戲開發者永久封鎖。"

至官方網站詢問客服為何帳號永久封鎖，回覆是：
【因確認到您帳號中確實有異常遊戲紀錄，
故給予相對應的帳號懲處，
但為防止其他非正常的遊戲現象，
無法與您詳細說明相關的封鎖信息。】

我沒有使用其他"非官方的第三方程式進行遊戲"，我也很正常的在玩遊戲，封鎖了卻不給予詳細說明，我再開啟另外一個帳號，也是直接顯示永久封鎖，官方回覆永遠都是"異常遊戲紀錄"

一款花錢的遊戲能做得如此失敗，無緣由的就封別人號，也是挺厲害的

這遊戲真的不推薦,如果你想要公平競技，緊張刺激的槍戰，pubg絶對辦不到，越高分段越多外掛，伺服器延遲被隔牆打死屢見不鮮，擊殺鏡頭觀感奇差，有時殺你的人到底是不是外掛亦很難判斷，遊戲優化低劣，從早期的fps地圖優化到伺服器延遲,藍洞公司亦是得過且過，怠慢玩家的意見，一味只顧出造型賺錢，在商言商，遊戲出造型賺錢不是問題，前提是玩家體驗良好，但事實證明這遊戲公司毫無誠意,吃雞模式不是獨大，同時面對其他fps遊戲競爭，pubg繼續負評如潮，勸各位想入坑的玩家真的要考慮清楚。

这是我第一次差评，还是专门等加速器写的。隔了半年没玩吃鸡了，电脑玩巫师3卸载了吃鸡，结果今天给我发个消息把我号给封了      我不糙了撒！有神仙。专杀队友。含笑舔包等等。我都没事，想着算了一个游戏而已，不用跟孤儿一般计较。可是莫名其妙给我把我号给封了{其实问题不大，一个游戏而已，98就当我丢了}，就和吃面有苍蝇，聊天对面吐沫星子飞脸上一样。让我很恶心，这家游戏公司需要98来体现他们的品质，我也无所谓。封号不封那种号，给我这种体验别的游戏玩家给封了，我也是XXX。最后我想求助一下大佬们，知道怎么在游戏库中删去游戏吗？也就是不想再见到这个游戏。谢谢！以及给那些看到我的评论的人感到恶心的人说声：抱歉！

PUBG Corp initiated their "Fix PUBG" development sprint in early August and ended it with great fanfare in mid November. By mid September, the game was no longer competitively playable for me due to problems with UI transition frame latency. I would love to help debug this, but PUBG support's job description appears to be "annoy anyone who would try to report bugs with insane claims and demands until they go away". Support are absolutely fantastic at their jobs.

Additionally, the game will kick me for using any of the following:

* GPU power management software
* Twitch chat software
* A web browser
* VOIP software
* Stream management software
* Clock software
* Any form of authentication agent
* Any music software
* Any video software
* Any other game (such as while waiting fifteen minutes for a lobby)

The end result is that this game is essentially unstreamable for me.

Not that it was ever stable for me to begin with; I am reasonably certain the game has crashed and quit on me more than twice for each hour I have played it.

This was a nice game in terms of design. It's a pity the technical and business side makes me regret purchasing it.

this game, frankly, is an absolute disaster from start to finish.

To begin with, the core gameplay itself is still dominated by so many bugs, exploits and cheaters that it's difficult to actually tell if someone is cheating or if the game is just itself broken. Killcam weapons will snap to targets and be mysteriously absent of recoil. Players will know where you are through walls and floors. That kind of thing. The odds of fighting more than 2 or 3 groups before encountering a cheater or a could-be are so high that I don't think I can name a single time it's happened in my 200 hours of play. Ever.

That's not to say cheating is the only technical problem. A year after the game left early access and it's still a technically unsound, bug-riddled MESS in every aspect, from gunplay to vehicles to animations. The game is an unoptimized piece of shit, a problem which has only gotten worse. I use an R9-380 and FX8320 with 16 gigs of ram, totalling out at a solid machine. Playing on the lowest dirt settings where the game looks like a mobile port. The loading screens still occasionally take longer than the opening lobbies or even the entire plane ride for dropping. Distance models are frequently present upon landing, and loot doesn't load in sometimes for more than 30 seconds after I hit the ground, but only for me or anyone else affected - if you're fortunate enough to load the game in time, you have full access!

But of course, it's too limiting to say that the game's problems are limited to ONLY bugs, since there's also a slew of poor choices from PUBG corp to back up the idea. Why do players make less noise when they take their shoes off? Why are so many of the weapons noob traps? Why doesn't everyone spawn with a pistol? Why is this game so determined to be absolutely random in how it assigns weapons and gear?

The microtransactions and loot boxes are not just unnecessary, not just added post launch, not just insulting as a concept and in their implementation into this mess of a game, but downright compromise any progression experience the game offers because of it. The loot boxes that this game added undermine the core experience so severely that if you are interested in playing more than a couple games, you're shelling out anywhere from 5-15$ a week to be able to purchase keys for the rewards that you EARNED, most of the drops are either disgustingly ugly or completely unnoticable.

And none of this is even TOUCHING on the fundamental gameplay formula, which alternates between long periods of extensive all-encompassing boredom, and moments of life-or-death gameplay where if you were unfortunate enough to stop paying attention during that 10-minute run into the circle, you are killed instantly.

If I could, I would go back and stop myself from ever buying a copy of this game, and put that money towards anything else on my wish list. I'd put it towards gas in my car, or a couple of pizzas. The idea of PUBG being so successful is so emblematic of the gaming industry as a whole - successful despite being fundamentally broken, unoriginal, not fun to play, and in return for making billions, the developers implemented wave after wave of loot boxes instead of fixing it.

PUBG is fundamentally broken and anti-fun to play in every respect. If you read this, please, go buy something - literally anything - else instead.

So... Pubg... I see alot of negative reviews that are quite frankly somewhat fair and unfair to the product. 

I can say having paid for a few keys and the pre-release game that for the $30-$50 that this game has cost me, I have gotten my moneys worth.  Over a year of solid online play has been had with friends in squads and thats definitely a shit-ton of time.  

The issues suggested by others are many:
1) Region blocking due to cheats
2) Cheat protection was poor
3) Network Latency/deseync is high and still a problem
4) New content has been very slow to release, maps, guns, etc
5) Poor release schedule on updates, almost always ran long
6) Game seems to have become a skin-engine (like Counter Strike)
7) Map glitches causing damage/movement issues

Some of those issues are with the company and some with the gamer design. Here's the fundamental goods about the game.
1) Methodical paced games.
2) Solid gun play feel and weight
3) Great positional audio/sound work 
4) Enjoyable coop feel for a small team
6) 3 large/well placed maps.
7) Decent transport system

Overall I'd say this game when played with a good group of well intentioned fun seekers is still  a fun game.  Part of the original fun was in the jank from the game and as BlueHole has tried to push this game into a more polished and e-sports-capable state, it has suffered some with the crowd due to the ridiculous nature of deaths and general fun/sillyness dropping away.   At this point the game has large flaws, map issues with odd placement of momentum stopping dips, vehicle oddness in movement code, general desync between players engagements, and some basic problems with region protection and cheater prevention.  

It is still however fun with a good group of people.  Is it worth the price now?  I don't know, but I will say that it was for me and I've enjoyed my time with this game.   Will I continue to play?  Probably because its still relatively enjoyable with the right friends.   However I will likely move on eventually to another more polished game due to the slow release and often poorly defined release cycle of the developers game updates.  I think it is getting better, but I'm not sure if the future holds any meaningful updates for this game.

So, after playing this game for 300+ hours i can say that the game itself its stil kinda interesting and fun BUT:  First, i have played this game for a long time and quit then i came back 6 months later and i can say this: game is still extremely bugy, servers still lag as hell, loot still spawns few seconds later after you drop, and you need to run back for the item that may save your life, hackers, overall movment is still kinda shity , jumping over walls, stucking on something random, loot on Erangel and Miramal is still bad, and instead focusing on only thing that is fun in this game and thats shooting, im runnning building to building like Enzo Ferrari in hope to find gun to defend myself, no i dont need attachments i just need a gun to defend myself, overall feel of progression is bad, simple quests, shitty rewards not worth going for, only thing that i noticed that im maybe geting 5-10 fps more but thats discussable. All those things are tolerable only when playing with friends. Playing this solo for me and going through all things mentioned above feels unenjoyable and frustrating. There are games that just do things better than this.

2018年10月21日无缘无故封禁我一个帐号。、该帐号ID：（1OO86-11）
今天2018年11月30日登录游戏提示被开发者永久封禁。该帐号ID：（10086---11）
我不明白，每天被外挂虐。反到是我被封禁？难道是我不买皮肤不消费？
开发者不去治理外挂。为什么会对我这样的贫民玩家实施封禁。
发送邮件给官网。收到的回复是：很遗憾的告诉您因帐号在游戏中的确存在非正常游戏行为，所以我们维持对该帐号的处理结果。还希望我理解。 （我很想清楚明白的知道我自己那一点存在非正常游戏行为了我他妈的改还不行么。）
你告诉我 我怎么去理解 500多场 KDA 1.4 宗师段位。 游戏ID：10086---11 。1OO86-11可查。
会看数据的人都知道。看看是不是使用辅助外挂之类的。 况且我也没有什么非法组队击杀队友。
希望该游戏的开发者能认真的看到。也希望绝地求生能越办越好。再见我曾经一度热爱的一款游戏。
外挂一直不封，皮肤出的比谁都快
游戏疑似官方卖成品号供开挂玩家开挂，本人号被盗后立即锁定账号，但盗号者还是可以正常访问并开挂，而且帐号找回时间与帐号封禁时间极度相似。最后当我找回帐号并游玩（落地成盒）后，再次永久封号，有欺骗消费者嫌疑。

I had fun.

Just waiting for more interesting content. Adding an ability to create custom games with friends (I. E. deathmatch warmode) without having to scrunge up 10 or 16 player (or whatever the limit is now) would greatly spark my interest in it again. Or when a new big map comes out.
